description: U.S.-led coalition invades Iraq without UN approval.
ICC begins its first investigation into Lord's Resistance Army crimes.
Mass atrocities in Sudan’s Darfur region spark global outrage.
Lubanga becomes the first person taken into ICC custody.
Final military offensive results in mass civilian deaths; no ICC case opened.
ICC issues arrest warrant for Libyan leader during civil war.
Lubanga convicted for conscripting child soldiers.
Over 2,000 Palestinians were killed during Operation Protective Edge. ICC did not open a prosecution.
Jean-Pierre Bemba convicted for war crimes in Central African Republic.
Civilian bombings by Saudi-led coalition; no ICC prosecutions.
Trial begins for Timbuktu destruction and sexual slavery.
Reports of war crimes in Ethiopia, no ICC action taken.
Dominic Ongwen sentenced to 25 years for war crimes in Uganda.
Russia invades Ukraine; global calls for ICC action.
ICC issues arrest warrant for Vladimir Putin for deportation of Ukrainian children.
Israeli bombardment of Gaza leads to 30,000+ deaths; ICC issues preliminary statements.
Ongoing prosecution of Libyan warlords responsible for mass executions in Tarhuna.
